sources.name: World Bank WDI (Food Exports)
sources.description:
Data published by World Bank
Data publisher's source

World Bank staff estimates from the Comtrade database maintained by the United Nations Statistics Division
Link http://data.worldbank.org/indicator/TX.VAL.FOOD.ZS.UN
Retrieved06/09/2016

 

Food comprises the commodities in SITC sections 0 (food and live animals), 1 (beverages and tobacco), and 4 (animal and vegetable oils and fats) and SITC division 22 (oil seeds, oil nuts, and oil kernels).

sources.name: World Bank WDI (Manufacture Exports)
sources.description:
Data published by World Bank
Data publisher's source

 

World Bank staff estimates from the Comtrade database maintained by the United Nations Statistics Division.
Link http://data.worldbank.org/indicator/TX.VAL.MANF.ZS.UN
Retrieved07/09/2016

 

Manufactures comprise commodities in SITC sections 5 (chemicals), 6 (basic manufactures), 7 (machinery and transport equipment), and 8 (miscellaneous manufactured)

sources.name: OECD Economic Outlook (Transaction Costs)
sources.description:
Data published by

OECD Insights - Economic Globalisation: Origins and Consequences
Data publisher's source

OECD (2007), OECD Economic Outlook, Vol. 2007/1, OECD Publishing.
Linkhttp://www.oecd-ilibrary.org/economics/economic-globalisation_9789264111905-en
Retrievede.g. 18/08/2015

Sea fright corresponds to average international freight charges per tonne. Passenger air transport corresponds to average airline revenue per passenger mile until 2000 spliced to US import air passenger fares afterwards. International calls correspond to cost of a three-minute call from New York to London.
